landing-data-token.title: $DATA Token
landing-data-token.description: Cultivate a more open, secure, and equitable internet where everyone, including robots, are equals when facing opportunities in Web3
landing-data-token.description-2-details: The Methodology is on this page under Token Inclusion Critieria, Index Weight Calculation, and Index Maintenance
landing-data-token.tg-1-details: DATA is a convenient way for investors to gain exposure in a single ERC-20 token without having to constantly research and rebalance a portfolio.
landing-data-token.tg-2-details: DATA is the first index in the market providing exposure to the Data Economy.
landing-data-token.tg-3-details: DATA provides reduced gas costs and tax-efficient rebalancing.
landing-data-token.tg-4-details: The volatility of individual tokens is offset by holding an index and quarterly rebalances prevent overconcentration.
landing-data-token.tg-5-details: The index follows a transparent methodology to assess tokens for inclusion and removal.

section-desc.title: Objective
section-desc.description-1: The Data Economy Index (DATA) is a digital asset index capturing the growth of data economies with significant economic activity.
section-desc.description-2: The DATA index is data centric and chain agnostic. DATA includes tokens from blockchain that provides data-based products or services.

content.title: Data-based Protocol:
content.details: The protocol provides data-based services or products.

content.title: Ethereum Token:
content.details: The token must be available on the Ethereum blockchain. This will be revised if the Set Protocol infrastructure becomes multi-chain.

content.title: Organic Network Activity or Usage:
content.details: Protocol must have organic network activity or usage. On-chain transaction volume, Total Value Locked (TVL), and/or revenue paid to service providers are all examples of metrics that can be used to demonstrate organic network activity.

content.title: Market Capitalization:
content.details: Circulating market capitalization must be over $100m. Decentralized Exchange (DEX) Liquidity: Protocol token must have sufficient DEX liquidity to support inclusion. If a token has insufficient liquidity, it will be removed from the index during the determination phase.

content.title: History:
content.details: Protocol must have at least 3 months history of operation and its token must have at least 3 months of price and liquidity history.

content.title: Security:
content.details: An independent security audit should have been performed on the protocol and results reviewed by the product methodologist. In the case that no audit has been performed, the methodologist applies subjective judgement of the protocol based on assessment of the criteria above and communications with the team.

faqs.name: Index Weight Calculation
faqs.description:
DATA will use circulating market capitalization to determine the weight of each token included in the index.

The weight of each token within the index will be as follows:

content.details: The Data Economy Index caps each tokenâ€™s respective weight at 25%.
Excess weight for a given token will be redistributed to the remaining components of the Data Economy Index on a weighted basis.
This same process will be repeated for every token exceeding the 25% allocation cap.

faqs.name: Index Maintenance
faqs.description: The index is maintained quarterly in two phases:

content.title: Determination Phase:
content.details: During the determination phase, the tokens being added and deleted from the index calculation are determined during the final week of the quarter and published before quarterly rebalancing.

content.title: Rebalancing Phase:
content.details: Following publication of the determination phase outcome, the index composition will change to the new weights during the first week of the following quarter.
